page.title: 01Stanway Area - A Brief Guide
page.content: Set where the edge of the{Vale of} {Evesham}rises to meet the{Cotswold} {Hills,}this is very much a rural area. 2 miles to the south lies{Winchcombe, {4 miles to the north lies Broadway, {The area is dominated by Stanway House {and its surrounding}Estate. Running north-south through the area is the A46 road whilst west-east the A438 from Tewkesbury becomes the B4077 to Stow-on-the-Wold. The villages of Stanway and Didbrook}are the major settlements together with{Wood Stanway and the New Town area of{Toddington. Various farms scatter the area. Most are mixed{farms,}growing mainly wheat and barley and rearing sheep and cows. Trees are also very evident on the landscape. The area sees a mixture of the Vale timber-framed houses and the stone buildings of the Cotswold Escarpment.
